channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15667] Add more clarity to Reference Guide related to importing Eclipse Formatter
item.description:
In Hbase Reference Guide:
141.1.1. Code Formatting
in procedure bullet point 2: It is not clear what the menu item is.
It should be changed to the following:
"In Preferences, click Java->Code Style->Formatter"
item.summary: Add more clarity to Reference Guide related to importing Eclipse Formatter

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: patch not attached
Attached Patch File with changed documentation.

FYI Sai, the process is that you attach the patch and then move the status to 'submit patch'. That will get your patch run against the continuous integration system. Next up, a committer will review your patch and commit it if it looks good.

I've reopened this issue and will next submit it so you see what happens next.

Welcome Sai Teja Ranuva
I submitted the patch so it gets applied and tests run against it to ensure it breaks nothing.
Changes status to 'improvement' from 'wish'.

Added patch with some changes.
stack I am unable to find anything like submit patch, but the status is patch available. Would Hadoop QA check for newly attached patches automatically ?
Sai Teja Ranuva Sometimes it takes a while for the CI system to come around. If it has not run by morning, I'll retry submission. Thanks Sai Teja Ranuva
Try renaming the patch... removing the '_'.
'_' is being used in patches of other issues(HBASE-15675). I think it might be due to other reasons.

This message was automatically generated.

Try a donothing patch.

Having trouble debugging this one. Seems like site build is having issue because so many javadoc errors/warnings... Was looking at cleaning them up but there are 100 of them.
I will try to look at them over this weekend, I think mvn clean site gives the list of the errors/warnings you mentioned.
Sai Teja Ranuva The warnings/errors are just messed up javadoc that we should fix. I think this obscures actual reason for fail. Let me see if can get more info.

Ok. There was an error in the asciidoc fixed by our @misty as an addendum on the breaking change over at HBASE-15572

Lets try the patch here again.
Reattach Sai Teja Ranuva's last patch. See how it does now that asciidoc has been fixed up.
Also of note is that the javadoc 100 'errors' come of our building master w/ 1.8 which we just switched too... Will follow up on this probably in a new issue.

Pushed to master branch.

The complaint was pretty plain in the end (after Misty and Sean helped me out). There were various tests timing out. We just got a run where nothing timed out. Let me commit (quick). Smile.
